C

ClackClient - Class in <Unnamed>
The ClackClient class represents the client user.
ClackClient(String, String, int) - Constructor for class ClackClient
Constructor for username, hostname, and port, connection should be set to open, and should set dataToSendToClient and dataToReceiveFromServer to null
ClackClient(String, String) - Constructor for class ClackClient
Constructor to set up port to default number 7000 as a constant, should call another constructor
ClackClient(String) - Constructor for class ClackClient
constructor that sets host name to be "localhost"
ClackClient() - Constructor for class ClackClient
default constructor that sets anonymous user, should call another constructor
ClackData - Class in <Unnamed>
Class ClackData is a superclass that represents the data sent between the client and the server.
ClackData(String, int) - Constructor for class ClackData
constructor to set up userName and type, date should be automatically created here
ClackData(int) - Constructor for class ClackData
constructor to create anonymous user, whose name is "Anon" should call another constructor
ClackData() - Constructor for class ClackData
default constructor, should call another
ClackServer - Class in <Unnamed>
ClackServer is a blueprint for a ClackServer object that contains information about the port number that clients connect to, a boolean representing whether the server needs to be closed or not, and ClackData objects representing data sent to and received from client
ClackServer(int) - Constructor for class ClackServer
constructor that sets port number, should set data ToReceiveFromClient and dataToSendToClient as null
ClackServer() - Constructor for class ClackServer
default constructor that sets port number to 7000

E

equals(Object) - Method in class ClackClient
compares data and returns true if all data is the same
equals(Object) - Method in class ClackServer
compares data and returns true if all data is the same
equals(Object) - Method in class FileClackData
returns true if username, type, filename, and file contents are all the same
equals(Object) - Method in class MessageClackData
compares usernames, types and messages, then returns true if all are the same

FileClackData() - Constructor for class FileClackData
default constructor sets up fileName and fileContents to null, and type to 0
